descriptions.description: Developer's Turnover reduces the Core Developer stock as experienced members leave the project.
Skill up increases the New Contributors stock by transitioning individuals from the onboarding pool.
Skill up increases the Experienced Contributors stock by advancing capable New Contributors.
Promotion Rate increases the Experienced Contributors stock by advancing New Contributors.
Promotion Rate increases the Core Developer stock by elevating committed Experienced Contributors.
Implicit Knowledge Transfer accelerates Skill up by providing direct mentorship and guidance.
Implicit Knowledge Transfer increases the Promotion Rate by preparing contributors for more advanced roles.
More Core Developers increase Implicit Knowledge Transfer capacity through direct mentorship.
Explicit Knowledge Transfer facilitates Skill up by providing accessible learning resources and documentation.
The colored stock (onboarding pool) feeds the New Contributors stock as individuals join the project.
A larger pool of New Contributors increases the potential flow for Skill up as more people are learning.
A larger Core Developer group can increase Developer's Turnover due to burnout or career progression.
A larger pool of Experienced Contributors increases the potential Promotion Rate to Core Developer.
